title: 114_hr2656
content: The Act is titled the "Receiving Electronic Statements To Improve Retiree Earnings Act" and it involves electronic communication of pension plan information under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Act allows pension plan documents to be furnished electronically if the system ensures effective access for participants through direct delivery or online posting. The Act permits electronic furnishing of pension plan documents to participants, beneficiaries, or individuals, with proper notice and the ability to select the electronic means for document delivery. The Act allows electronic delivery of pension plan documents with the option to switch to paper versions at no extra cost, ensuring confidentiality of personal information. An annual paper notice must be provided describing the electronic means chosen or any election made. The Act permits electronic delivery of pension plan documents with the option for paper versions upon request. Electronic documents must adhere to formatting requirements and include a notice explaining their significance. The Act allows electronic delivery of pension plan documents with the option for paper versions upon request. Formatting requirements must be followed for electronic documents, along with a notice explaining their significance. A conforming amendment is made to the table of contents in the Act. Electronic communication of pension plan information is allowed under the Act, with documents being furnished in electronic form if certain conditions are met for effective access by participants. Electronic communication of pension plan information is permitted under the Act through various electronic means, including posting material on a website or other electronic repository with proper notice, and using other electronic methods to ensure receipt by participants. The Act allows electronic communication of pension plan information, giving individuals the choice of selecting how they receive documents and ensuring confidentiality of personal information. An annual paper notice must be provided to describe the electronic means chosen for document delivery. The Act permits electronic communication of pension plan information, allowing individuals to choose how they receive documents. An annual paper notice must be given to explain the chosen electronic delivery method. The electronically furnished document must adhere to specific style, format, and content requirements and include a notice highlighting its significance. The amendments made by this section allow electronic communication of pension plan information, defining the term 'document' broadly. These changes apply to documents provided for plan years starting after December 31, 2015.
